page.title: 11 PARKINSON'S GARAGE
page.content: Parkinson's Garage is situated on the A63 through Hambleton. It was first owned by Mr.Wells and taken over in 1952 by the Parkinson family.It was a British Leyland garage until 1978 but it now sells Fiat cars .The garage also sells any make of second hand car.It sells about 100 new cars a year.The busiest time for car sales is August.The most popular car is the Uno and the most expensive is the Abarth which costs Â£7800.16. Most of the cars are imported from Turin in Italy.The petrol tanks hold 9000 gallons.The Fina petrol comes from Leeds.The tanks are refilled every 10 days,and they sell about 3000 gallons a week.When the garage was opened the petrol cost 3s 9\ pence(18p) and now costs Â£1.99 .There are 20 workers at the garage most of which work in the workshop, where repairs and servicing are done.
